meanings.sent1: She is liquidating her debts by slowly paying them off each month.
meanings.sent2: The company is liquidating its outstanding debts to improve its financial standing.
meanings.sent3: Liquidating her debts feels like a weight being lifted off her shoulders.
meanings.sent4: In the game of financial management, liquidating debts is the ultimate goal.
meanings.sent5: Liquidating debts is like cleaning up a messy room, one item at a time.

meanings.sent1: The business is liquidating its assets to generate cash flow.
meanings.sent2: Liquidating the property will provide the necessary funds for the new project.
meanings.sent3: He joked that liquidating assets felt like turning his belongings into a vending machine.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, liquidating assets can be a quick solution to financial problems.
meanings.sent5: Liquidating assets is like turning possessions into a valuable resource.

meanings.definition: To dissolve a business by selling off its assets
meanings.sent1: The owners are liquidating the company after years of operation.
meanings.sent2: Liquidating the business was the only option left for the struggling owners.
meanings.sent3: The idea of liquidating the business sounded like closing a chapter in a book.
meanings.sent4: In tough times, liquidating a business can be a bittersweet decision.
meanings.sent5: Liquidating a business is like dismantling a puzzle to start a new one.
